#440

- Growing terrestrially, scattered in mixed oak/hickory woodland.
- Nearby Trees: Chinkapin Oak, Northern Red Oak, Bitternut Hickory, American Hophornbeam and Shagbark Hickory.
- Caps brownish-gray with splitting fiber texture more evident near the margins.
- Lamellae adnexed with decurrent tooth, dull white with dark specks on the faces.
- Stipe white and slightly enlarging near base.

Additional Details
- Smell: not distinctive
- Taste: bitter
- Spore Print: white
- Microscopy: mounted in KOH
